node.text:
7 years ago today, the @blackmagicnewsofficial Blackmagic Cinema Camera 2.5K EF (along with the camera handles) arrived! I remember waking up right before my first college class of the day and seeing all the NAB coverage sites talking about it. Theres a small story on how we got this camera that I’ll elaborate on one of these days. This was the camera that sparked our “cinematic” filmmaking journey. Fun times.

You can see the first few things that we shot with the camera along with one of the first times I ever used Resolve. ~ Note

#blackmagicdesign #blackmagiccinemacamera #ursamini #gear #throwback #camera #bmcc #bmpcc @blackmagicnewsofficial @blackmagicdesign_news

Camera setup!

Ursa Mini Pro G2
Blackmagic RAW 12:1 
Lens: Rapido FVD 16 + Ultra Star Red
Wireless: @cinegears Ghost Eyes 500m
Chamois:@bluestar

Blackmagic Pocket 4K
Blackmagic RAW 8:1
S16 mode 
ISO: 2500
Lens: Kiev 16U 20mm @ 2.8

@delahuntthom came over since we were all heading over before the #seattle48hfphorror premiere and I decided to take a shot with the Kiev 16 20mm lens. We’ve had this lens and the adapter for a few years now after buying as part of a package. 
The lighting is mostly natural, with the main source being sunlight coming from the window. There’s some fill with an @asteraofficial titan tube + @honeycrates baby bee on the right side of his face for some extra controlled fill. I was going to bounce some but couldn’t find the bounce board in time. The Pocket 4K and these lenses pair very well. They give off a vintage-y old school vibe. You’ll notice that 2.6K is still very detailed but not overtly sharp. The room was darker than it looks hence why the iso was set at 2500. •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• #blackmagicdesign #lighting #cinematography #camera video #gear #dslr #lighting #blackmagicpocketcinemacamera #videomaker #film #production #cinema #actors #behindthescenes #bts #bmpcc4k  #acting #color #lens #filmmakerslife #s16 #filmmaker #behindthescenes #framez #setlife @filmconvert @blackmagicnewsofficial @blackmagicdesign_news @blackmagicpocketcinemacamera

A single titan works well with the Pocket 4K, given you can go to that second iso set if needed. •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• #blackmagicdesign #lighting #cinematography #camera #ursamini #video #gear #dslr #lighting #ursaminiprog2 #videomaker #film #production #cinema #actors #behindthescenes #bts #bmpcc4k #acting #color #lens #filmmakerslife #ursaminipro #cinematographer #filmmaker #behindthescenes #framez #setlife @blackmagicnewsofficial @blackmagicdesign_news

Behind the scenes for a much lighter project than usual. It was a fun filming day! 
This was the firs time we used a 12x12 with an ultra ounce. (great work @talusmoloney + @nutsuwanchote). The reflected light was soft and natural on the two talents. Originally, we were going to use hilite to diffuse the sun but the weather changed last minute!

Ursa Mini Pro G2
Blackmagic RAW 8:1 + Q5
4.6K

Stills from @kinetic_film shot sometime in early and mid 2018. @eden.raine.campbell and @_____payne_____  were awesome to work with during these two days. Thanks to @john_legas for allowing us to film at this location! 
Both of these were shot with the Ursa Mini Pro G1 and the awesome Letus Anamorphot 1.33X adapter. It’s interesting looking back and grading footage. I wonder if object removal could work for the 🧯😂. Awesome BTS thanks to @adlapine!

Ursa Mini Pro G1
Lens:
Sigma 18-35mm
Rokinon 50mm
Letus Anamorphot 1.33X

Final trailer for @kinetic_film, Kinetic! It’s been a long time coming but I’m super excited to see get released. It started off as @nuksuwanchote college project (and we started filming) in 2016. 
We’ve learned an incredible amount. The journey of this short reflects our friends and our own filmmaking journey.

Behind the scenes for a location and concept work with the wonderful @delahuntthom. We were experimenting with Rip Stop Nylon bought from Joanne’s to mimic 1/2 grid cloth. 
In addition, this scene was shot with both anamorphic and spherical with the same setup but the BTS photo shows anamorphic but it’s spherical. Thanks to @real_dealray for allowing us to film at this location!

Blackmagic RAW 8:1

Seeing some before and after shots and thought we’d post up a few. This was for the 2018 Seattle 48 Hour Film Project. Had a lot of fun shooting this project. Using a 1.33X anamorphic adapter gives a ratio that is a bit more than 2.36 in the end. Easy to crop if needed.
4.6K Anamorphic: 4608 x 1949 or so.

Getting gear prepped for a shoot we’re helping on. 
Kudos to @izaakfromspace , @nutsuwanchote and Lalo for stepping up big time. Couldn’t have been possible without these three! 
Shooting with the @aputuretech 300D against a @honeycrates 4X4 along with Ripstop Nylon. Using Nylon has been interesting so far but we’ll get back to bleached muslin or try something new soon. 
Since the @_instamic_ can now do TC over Bluetooth, it’s easy to set it as a plant/foley mic alongside the @tentacle_sync E!

From top to tottom:
•Bare 300D
•4X4 Diffusion
•4X4 Diffusion with Honey Crates

The sixth photo is the previous one but with small adjustments in Resolve applied.

First of a few simple, lighting tests. This one with the @honeycrates 4X4 and Ripstop Nylon. Thanks to the wonderful @delahuntthom for being our subject! Shot on the @blackmagicdesignnews Ursa Mini Pro G2 via Blackmagic RAW and Sigma Art 18-35mm (no diffusion). The setup was simple: an @aputuretech 300D shooting through a window that was had a @westcottlighting 4X4 frame and some Rip Stop Nylon bought at Joanne’s all through an LCD (Light Control Device), the Honeycrates 4X4. The Rip Stop Nylon was chosen since I wanted to see what that was like and our normal diffusion material—bleached muslin—was torn. 
The sidelight was chosen because that’s what’s available at the time. There’s a version with a bounce but I wanted to showcase an isolated one first. 
I’ll do more of these tests since I’m also intrigued about the differences and I’ll make a blog post in conjunction with some quick grading thoughts soon. •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• @ursamini  #blackmagicdesign #lighting #cinematography #camera #ursamini #video #gear #dslr #lighting #ursaminiprog2 #videomaker #film #production #cinema #actors #behindthescenes #bts #bmpcc4k  #acting #color #lens #filmmakerslife #ursaminipro #cinematographer #honeycrates #westscottlighting #filmmaker #behindthescenes #framez #setlife @blackmagicnewsofficial @blackmagicdesign_news

This 48 was fun, with large, unexpected challenges right from the start and right at the end. Yet the challenges made it particularly exciting, especially as crunch time neared. Thank you everyone, that came, for joining us this past weekend. We were astounded by the endurance, flexibility, and generosity of each and everyone one of you!

Thanks to @thisguy206, @rjslifee , and Lalo, for taking these behind the scenes photos and video. 
Thanks for coming @izaakfromspace @donkelliejr @john_legas @growinguppeyton @d_peirce @inconceivable_to_human_minds  @hitle2805 @delahuntthom @real_dealray @izaakfromspace @talusmoloney @aaronshabansky @jacobschu35 @monellgsnyder @official_colettesmartt @shaomoki •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• #lighting #cinematography #camera #ursamini #video #gear #dslr #sea48hfp19 #videomaker #production #indiefilmmaker #indiefilmmaking #lighting #camera #film #setlife #cinema #bmpcc4k #ursaminiprog2  #blackmagicdesign #filmmakerslife #ursaminipro #cinematographer #filmmaker #setlife #bts #anamorphic #bmpcc4k @filmcrewmagazine @blackmagicnewsofficial @ursamini @blackmagicdesign_news

We did the #sea48hfp19 this past weekend and it was a memorable journey. We had some big challenges from the start, but nevertheless, it was fun! 
As we start using more lighting equipment, we’ll do more behind the scenes of the setups. For these particular frames, the @aputuretech 300D was shot through a @westcottlighting 4x4 frame + Bleached Muslin from @his nn_stores. 
We had @honeycrates 4x4 grid attached to the frame which allowed us to noticeably better control the direction of the light (I’ll be doing some tests ASAP since this is a combo I’ve wanted to try out after seeing BTS shots on @filmlights)

The Ursa Mini Pro G2 and anamorphic setup with the Sigma 50 Art is particularly enticing since usually we’re able to shoot wide open.

Ursa Mini Pro G2
Blackmagic RAW Q5
3K Anamorphic @ 24fps 
Rapido FVD + Isco Ultra Star Red 
Sigma 50mm Art 1.4

Filming @delahuntthom for our proof of concept. The first image is a random shot but we loved the dynamic range the UMP G2 showed. The second image, the only thing that lit Thom was the fire at ~T4. I was debating on using a few lights but the timing didn’t allow us to do that!

Ursa Mini Pro G2
Blackmagic RAW 12:1 
3K Anamorphic @ 24 and 120fps
@Atlaslensco 50mm T2 for the second image and the Rapido + Isco Ultra Star and Sigma 50mm Art for the top.
